contentList.content: Emitting an aura of instruction to nearby musical sprites and spirits.
If you can see this it is a bug.
Start a performance on one of Ember's instruments; this musical spirit will join you.
This spirit will play along with performances on Ember's instruments.
A mysterious portal through which only music can travel.
Intentionally hidden. If you can see this, it is a bug.
If you can see this it is a bug.
If you can see this it is a bug.
Intentionally hidden. If you can see this, it is a bug.
Music-loving instrument sprites will join in with songs played on this instrument.
The auto-summoning of musical sprites to complete musical performances is being suppressed.
Invisible drum used by musical sprites
Drum sprites will auto-join music performances.
Toggle drum track silence in musical performances.
Toggle flute track silence in musical performances.
Toggle violin track silence in musical performances.
Toggle lyre track silence in musical performances.
Toggle lute track silence in musical performances.
Toggle vocal track silence in musical performances.
Use Passive toggles to conduct instruments in and out of silence while performing music.
Intentionally hidden. If you can see this, it is a bug.
Invisible drum used by musical sprites
Invisible flute used by musical sprites
An invisible lute used by the musical sprites
An invisible violin used by the musical sprites
Flute sprites will auto-join music performances.
Lyre sprites will auto-join music performances.
Lute sprites will auto-join music performances.
Violin sprites will auto-join music performances.
Toggle on to add the vocal (whistling) track to music performances.
Mysterious musical sprites dance around the performer whenever music is played on this instrument.
Perform with musical sprites. Check your Passives to toggle instruments while you are performing.
Tiny, dancing lights run back and forth across the surface of this lute.
Check your Passives to toggle instruments while you are performing.
Tiny, dancing lights run back and forth across the surface of this lute.
Tiny dancing instrument sprites flit around the keyhole of this chest.
A sturdy chest for storing all manner of unusual and interesting instruments.
Check your Passives to toggle instruments while you are performing.
Tiny, dancing lights run back and forth across the surface of this lute.
Check your Passives to toggle instruments while you are performing.
Tiny, dancing lights run back and forth across the surface of this lute.
Sprites are changing the appearance of your instrument.
Apply a subtle smoke and sparkles visual effect.
Toggle off to suppress the music performance VFX.
A smoke and sparkles visual is applied to this lute.
The auto-summoning of musical sprites is enabled.
Apply a purple script glowmap effect.
A purple script glowmap visual is applied to this lute.
Mysterious musical sprites inhabit this instrument.
[Toggle off to perform single instrument tracks only.]
Tiny, colourful instrument sprites flit eagerly around the lute rose, awaiting the next performance.
Has been granted musical gifts. Will automatically join in with nearby performances if the lead perfomer is using one of Ember's instruments. Effects will wear off after a long rest.
Instrument sprites will grant musical gifts to your nearby party. They will auto join in with music if the lead perfomer is using one of Ember's instruments.
Effects will wear off after a long rest.
Instrument sprites will grant musical gifts to your nearby party.
A glowing purple sheet music visual is applied to this lute.
Apply a glowing purple sheet music effect.
A glowing blue sheet music visual is applied to this lute.
Apply a glowing blue sheet music effect.
Apply a visual to the equipped instrument.
Apply a glowing purple sheet music visual to the equipped instrument.
Apply a glowing blue sheet music visual to the equipped instrument.
A glowing white sheet music visual is applied to this lute.
A glowing blue sheet music visual is applied to this lute.
A glowing purple flourish visual is applied to this lute.
A glowing white flourish visual is applied to this lute.
Apply a glowing white sheet music visual to the equipped instrument.
Apply a glowing purple flourish visual to the equipped instrument.
Apply a visual to the equipped instrument.
Apply a glowing blue flourish visual to the equipped instrument.
Apply a glowing white flourish visual to the equipped instrument.
Clear any glowmap effects from the equipped instrument.
Clear any glowmap effects from the equipped instrument.
Use <LSTag Tooltip="Concentration">Concentration</LSTag> to perform music in combat. Not available out of combat.
While focused on a musical performance in-combat, you are unable to take actions or move. Break <LSTag Tooltip="Concentration">Concentration</LSTag> to restore your action points and movement.
Intentionally hidden. If you can see this, it is a bug.
Proud member of the once popular Rock Gnome musical ensemble, Vicious Rockery.
Ahead of their time, their band name often lead to assumptions they were specialists in stone-based gardening rather than performing.
Intentionally hidden. If you can see this, it is a bug.
If you can see this it is a bug.
Call upon the departed souls of the long-forgotten Rock Gnome ensemble, The Vicious Rockery.
This slightly scratched lute has multi-coloured gnomes decal on its body.
This lute offers an alternative way to perform with spirits and sprites. Summon the Vicious Rockery band members, play a song, and they will join in.
Several voices engaged in a heated but indiscernible argument can be heard when pressing one's ear against the lute rose.
Dismiss all Vicious Rockery ensemble members.
Call upon the departed souls of the long-forgotten Rock Gnome ensemble, The Vicious Rockery.
Sending instruction for 1 round of silence.
Playing a heartfelt tribute to lost friends..
Join the spirit of a tragic tiefling bard and play a heartfelt tribute to lost friends.
This is a legacy status for backwards compatibility. Please unequip and re-equip the Ember's Lute instrument to remove this.
This is a legacy status for backwards compatibility. Please unequip and re-equip the Ember's Lute instrument to remove this if it does not remove itself.
This spirit will vanish if violence breaks out.
The spirits within this lute grant you the title of Bard.
Dismissing sprites and musical spirit summons.
Spirit of a Tragic Tiefling Bard
Summon Melody Gearfiddle. Her rivals called her Queen Bow, because she wielded it like a rapier when crossed.
Summon Percival Stonegroove, the beat providing heart of The Vicious Rockery. He wrote the music and broke up the band-fights (all but the last one).
Summon Scorchwood Reedstorm, master of flute and theatrics. Scorchwood was almost certainly a stage name, but he never would admit it.
Summon Sprocket Puddlepop. He performed impressively with the lyre considering his life was spent wavering between inebriated and barely conscious.
Summon Lysandra Dusksong, gothic lutist and professional moper. She was known for scowling throughout any performances with a mildly upbeat melody.
Apply a glowing green sheet music visual to the equipped instrument.
Apply a glowing green sheet music visual to the equipped instrument.
A glowing green sheet music visual is applied to this lute.
A glowing green sheet music visual is applied to this lute.
Grants the ability to summon The Rolling Bones.
This lyre offers an alternative way to perform with spirits and sprites. Summon the Rolling Bones band members, play a song, and they will join in.
The lyre emits a dull rythmic rattling of bones and chains.
Toggle the instrument visual effects on or off on the Spider Lyre.
Lighting visual for the Spider's Lyre.
Eternally called, where matters of music are concerned.
Dismiss the undead musicians of The Rolling Bones.
Eternally called, where matters of music are concerned.
[If sprites are already summoned, step outside the white circle to dismiss them. The vocal sprite will be summoned the next time you perform music.]
Instrument tracks can be turned on and off mid-performance. Looks for the toggle options in your Passives toolbar.
"Music gives a soul to the universe, wings to the mind, flight to the imagination and life to everything."
"Nobody likes a whistler, particularly not the divinity that shapes our ends."
“Fills bring the thrills, but grooves pay the bills.”
"The breath is the bridge between the mind and the body."
“A table, a chair, a bowl of fruit and a violin; what else does a man need to be happy?”
“’T is believ’d that this harp which I wake now for thee, Was a siren of old who sung under the sea.”
“Guitar is easy. All it takes is 5 fingers, 6 strings, and one asshole.”
“You know how to whistle, don’t you, Steve? You just put your lips together and blow.”
Even though these statuses aren't used in this version, I think they need to be retained as empty headers at least, in case they are chilling out somewhere in someone's save game
Apply purple lighting with a smoke and sparkles effect.
Apply purple lighting with a smoke and sparkles effect.
Turn on the Spider Lyre green lighting effects.
Turn off the Spider Lyre green lights.
This lute will whistle along to any music performed on this instrument, whether you like it or not.
A chaotic lute that adds the whistling track whenever you perform music on it.
Ember had many a frustrating argument with this lute, insisting the only creatures that should be ever allowed to whistle in public are birds. The lute was having none of it.
The divine art of crescendo mastery.
Ember's scrawled notes on the Musical Sprites instruments.
As you tilt this bottle, a thick amber liquid emits gentle octaves of tinkling clinks and chimes.
You feel as if your performances could be improved by wearing these ordinary-looking pants. Perhaps even extended by whole minutes.
Neat and well-organised, though the back cover is partially missing and has a blackened, charred edge.
A quick explanation of the Instrument Varnishes (not to be confused with dyes).
Tattered and patchy underwear, that appears to have had an ethusiastic prior owner.
Ember's scrawled notes on the Annoying Lutes.
Even sealed, the scent from this bottle is sharp enough to sting the nostrils and water the eyes.
Ember's scrawled notes on the Ensemble Summoning instruments.
Perform music, and the whistling lute will join in.
Unable to resist doing a little jig.
Singing (or whistling) like no one is listening. They are probably listening, perhaps unfortunately for them.
This poor unfortunate has been compelled to join in whenever Sing For Me is performed nearby.
This poor unfortunate has been compelled to dance whenever Bard Dance is performed nearby.
As if whistling in public wasn't annoying enough.
Does someone look like they are not enjoying the music enough? Let's fix that: it's non-negotiable fun-time!
Whenever 'Bard Dance' is performed nearby, the victim of this curse will be compelled to dance.
Apply this curse to some poor soul and improve the literal accuracy of Sing For Me performances.
Exchange "friendly" banter using your most creative cusses, and possibly daze the recipient with your incredible wit.
Whenever 'Sing For Me' is performed nearby, the victim of this curse will be compelled to join the performance.
The spirit of the lute emits a swarm of instrument sprites that will attempt to apply a circus-themed makeover to the target.
A swarm of musical sprites will attempt to paint the face of the unsuspecting target. A successful dexterity save will evade the clown makeover.
Oi, ugly! A mischievious lute spirit wants to start a warring of wits and has granted the Mild Mockery cantrip.
Naughty musical sprites are applying face paint. Will it be an improvement?
Narrowly avoided an unwelcome face painting.
Remove conditions compelling the victim to dance or perform against their will.

You and any allies within [1] have a [2] bonus to Charisma, <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> against being <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CHARMED">Charmed</LSTag> or <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FRIGHTENED">Frightened</LSTag>.

You and any allies within [1] have a [2] bonus to Charisma, <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> against being <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CHARMED">Charmed</LSTag> or <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FRIGHTENED">Frightened</LSTag>.

You have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> against being <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CHARMED">Charmed</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FRIGHTENED">Frightened</LSTag>. You also have a [1] bonus to Charisma rolls.

You and any allies within [1] have a [2] bonus to Charisma, <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> against being <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CHARMED">Charmed</LSTag> or <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FRIGHTENED">Frightened</LSTag>.
Does someone look like they are not enjoying the music enough? Let's fix that: it's non-negotiable fun-time!
Whenever 'Bard Dance' is performed nearby, the victim of this curse will be compelled to dance.
Need to turn the tide of a battle? The lute spirit proposes an aura of indiscriminate wild magic. It... might help.
Need to turn the tide of a battle? The lute spirit proposes an aura of indiscriminate wild magic. It... might help.

You and any allies within [1] have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> against being <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CHARMED">Charmed</LSTag> or <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FRIGHTENED">Frightened</LSTag>. You also have a [2] bonus to Charisma rolls.
Any creature within this aura has a [1] chance to trigger wild magic each turn.
Wild magic is stirred up by the dissonant chords of a nearby chaos charm.
A naughty musical sprite has painted your face!
Pants?! Where did.. WHY ARE THEY TICKING?
This poor unfortunate has been compelled to dance whenever Bard Dance is performed nearby.
This poor unfortunate has been compelled to join in whenever Sing For Me is performed nearby.
Magical varnish has imbued this instrument with a mysterious connection to otherworldly, musical realms.
Magical varnish has imbued this instrument with a mysterious connection to otherworldly, musical realms.
Slightly off-key whistling can be heard as you approach this chest, shortly followed by a muffled giggle.
This chest holds strong bonds to the souls of long-forgotten musical ensembles.
Contains a few miscelleaneous bonus items.
Not to be mistaken for dyes. Varnishes let you temporarily grant the various abilities of Ember's instruments to other instruments of Faerûn.
You feel a sudden drop in temperature as you regard this chest.
The effects of this varnish will be removed when you unequip the instrument. Cannot be applied to another Spirit or Sprites instrument.
Apply this varnish to your equipped instrument, and gain the ability to summon the souls of long-forgotten Rock Gnome ensemble, The Vicious Rockery.
The effects of this varnish will be removed when you unequip the instrument. Cannot be applied to another Spirit or Sprites instrument.
Apply this varnish to your equipped instrument, and gain the ability to summon a music ensemble of the undead.
The effects of this varnish will be removed when you unequip the instrument.
Apply this varnish to your equipped instrument, and musical sprites will appear when you perform music.
The effects of this varnish will be removed when you unequip the instrument.
Apply this varnish to your equipped instrument, and musical sprites will appear when you perform music.
This is a violin alternative to the Lute of Musical Sprites. Differences are visual only.
This violin has a soft sheen to it, despite the rough edges and patchy varnishing.
Whenever 'Sing For Me' is performed nearby, the victim of this curse will be compelled to join the performance.
The lute spirit will grant the cantrip Mild Mockery to your current party. This'll be mean!
Summon the instrument chest into your inventory for [1] turns. After [1] turns it will disappear, along with all contents inside it.
Summon the instrument chest permanently. This can only be used in camp.
Dismiss the instrument chest, along with all of the contents inside it.
Spells to summon a chest of instruments.
A quick thank you, and a few tips to get you started.
A variant of the Lute of Musical Sprites with the vanilla lute B visual. Differences are aesthetic only.
Tiny, dancing lights run back and forth across the surface of this lute.
Temporarily summon Ember's chest of instruments into your inventory for [1] turns.
Chest contents will disappear along with the chest.
